access.description: The registered URL is a compliance hub page at ntst.com that lists certifications for all Netsmart products. It returns HTTP 200 directly with server-rendered HTML (no redirects, no SPA). The page contains links to 7 product-specific EHI export subpages (one per certified product), each of which has a 'CLICK HERE' download link for the product's EHI documentation (PDF or ZIP). All pages and downloads are publicly accessible via curl with a standard User-Agent header. No anti-bot protection, no login wall, no JavaScript required. Navigation is straightforward: main certifications page → product EHI subpage → download link.

product_context.description: Netsmart Technologies is a major health IT vendor specializing in behavioral health, human services, and post-acute care. Their products operate under the CareFabric platform. The six certified products span very different use cases: myAvatar is the flagship behavioral health EHR with full billing (837P/I/D, 835 remittance, NCPDP pharmacy), deep scheduling, treatment plans, and clinical documentation for inpatient/outpatient behavioral health, IDD, foster care, and CCBHCs. myEvolv is a mid-market configurable behavioral health EHR for child & family services, IDD, and autism, with auto-claim generation from clinical notes. myUnity is a post-acute care EHR for home health, hospice, senior living, and skilled nursing with unified patient records across care settings. CarePathways Measures Reporting is a data warehouse that aggregates data from Netsmart EHRs for quality measures and population health analytics. TheraOffice is a physical/occupational/speech therapy practice management and EMR system with integrated billing and scheduling. myHealthPointe is the cross-product patient engagement portal providing secure messaging, appointment requests, lab results viewing, and telehealth integration. Additional cross-product capabilities include CareConnect Inbox (secure messaging between providers), RevConnect (clearinghouse/claims management), and dedicated RCM services. The products collectively store extensive clinical, billing, scheduling, messaging, and administrative data.
product_context.certified_module_name: myAvatar Certified Edition, myEvolv Certified Edition, myUnity, CarePathways Measures Reporting, TheraOffice, myHealthPointe

export_approach.description: Netsmart provides separate EHI export documentation for each of its 6 certified products, reflecting their distinct architectures. The approach varies significantly by product: myAvatar uses native database table exports in delimited file format, covering 445 tables with extraordinarily deep billing, scheduling, and audit trail coverage — this is the gold standard among the Netsmart products. myEvolv exports JSON files organized by 'events' (clinical encounters/forms) and 'non-events' (demographics, configuration), with 1,679 event types and 250 non-event forms, plus base64-encoded attachments inline — clinically comprehensive but operationally limited. myUnity exports 24 distinct file types in JSON format covering a well-organized set of categories including claims, appointments, documents, and insurance. CarePathways exports 95 data warehouse tables (dim_* and fact_* format) queried via SQL — strong on analytics/measures data but reflecting its role as a reporting layer, not a primary EHR. TheraOffice exports 19 database tables focused on patient demographics and USCDI clinical data, with minimal billing detail. myHealthPointe exports only Subject Messages between patients and providers via a report tool — just 8 fields across 3 pages of documentation. Each product is a manual, one-time export that produces files per patient.

documentation_quality.description: Documentation quality varies dramatically across products. myAvatar has a 7,492-page PDF documenting 445 tables with field-level detail including column names, data types, and descriptions — extraordinarily comprehensive but produced as a single massive PDF that is difficult to navigate. myEvolv provides the most sophisticated documentation: a companion guide (docx) explaining the JSON export format, an Excel crosswalk with 115,663 field definitions across 5 sheets, and SQL queries for self-service schema discovery. myUnity has a well-organized 64-page PDF with 24 file types, each documented with field names, types, and descriptions. CarePathways has a 97-page PDF documenting 95 data warehouse tables with SQL query examples. TheraOffice has a concise 30-page PDF documenting 19 tables with column names and data types. myHealthPointe has just 3 pages describing a report export of 8 message fields. All products include data types and descriptions. None provide sample data, value set documentation, or explicit foreign key relationships (though myAvatar's table naming conventions imply relationships). The documentation is self-contained within each product's download.
documentation_quality.documentation_version: myAvatar Sep 2023; myEvolv v2; myUnity Fall 2024; CarePathways Sep 2024; TheraOffice May 2024; myHealthPointe Nov 2023

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Coverage varies enormously across Netsmart's 6 products. myAvatar is exceptional — 445 native database tables covering billing (114 tables including 837P/I/D, 835 remittance, NCPDP pharmacy claims, cash posting, self-pay), scheduling (34 tables including telehealth, EVV, waiting room), insurance/eligibility (21 tables including authorizations, 834 benefit enrollment), audit trails (46 tables), clinical data, treatment plans, and more. It is among the most comprehensive EHI exports in the industry. myUnity is also strong with 24 file types covering claims, claim charges, adjustments, appointments, eligibility, authorizations, documents, attachments, and insurance. myEvolv is clinically deep (1,679 event types) but weak on billing (only face-sheet views of claims, not raw billing tables), scheduling (events2do table not exported), and audit trails (update_log table referenced but not exported). CarePathways covers measures/reporting data well but is a reporting layer, not a primary EHR — it has claims and appointments but lacks messages, audit trails, and documents. TheraOffice is notably thin — only 19 tables focused on USCDI clinical data, with minimal billing (just a few fields in PTCASE) and no messages, documents, or audit data, despite the product having full billing, scheduling, and patient portal capabilities. myHealthPointe covers only secure messages (8 fields). The biggest gap across the suite is secure messaging — myHealthPointe stores patient-provider messages but its EHI documentation is extremely minimal, and none of the other products include portal message data. CareConnect Inbox messages appear absent from all exports.

clinical.evidence: All 6 products include clinical data. myAvatar: diagnoses (client_diagnosis_record/entry), medications (cw_client_medications, cw_home_medication_list), allergies (via CCD), vitals (cw_vital_signs), immunizations (cw_immunization_history), labs (results_upload), problem lists (cw_problem_list), progress notes (cw_patient_notes + 6 supplement tables), assessments (Columbia, PHQ2, CANS, mental status). myEvolv: 1,679 event types across allergies, diagnoses, medications (15 types), immunizations, labs (29 types), vitals, assessments (304+ public health, 254+ system). myUnity: CCD file (USCDI v1), PatientNotes, Orders, OrderAdministrations, Assessments. CarePathways: fact_allergy, fact_diagnosis, fact_immunization, fact_medicationorder, fact_prescription, fact_vitalsign, fact_problem, fact_careplan, fact_laboratoryresult. TheraOffice: PAT_PROFILE_USCDI tables for allergies, medications, problems, vitals, labs, immunizations, procedures, implant devices. myHealthPointe: none (portal messages only).

secure_messages.evidence: myHealthPointe exports Subject Messages between patients and providers with 8 fields (To, From, Sent, Read, Priority, Message Content, Response, Response Date) via a Reports applet. However, this is extremely limited — no threading, no metadata, and exported as PDF or Excel rather than structured data. myAvatar has pcp_communications and audit_pcp_communications tables for provider-to-provider communications but no patient portal messages. myEvolv has a Person Messages non-event form. myUnity, CarePathways, and TheraOffice do not appear to include any messaging data. CareConnect Inbox (the cross-product secure messaging system) does not appear in any product's export. Given that Netsmart markets HIPAA-compliant secure messaging across its platform, the coverage of messaging data is notably incomplete.

billing_financial.evidence: myAvatar is outstanding — 114 billing-related tables covering 837P/I/D electronic claims, 835 remittance processing, 276/277 claim status inquiry/response, billing charge detail (billing_tx_charge_detail, billing_tx_charge_totals), payment processing (front_desk_payment_entry, payment_acknowledgement, unacknowledged_payments), self-pay billing (billing_selfpay_stmt), claim adjustments (mso_claim_adjustments), fee schedules (billing_tx_master_fee_table), A/R tracking, NCPDP pharmacy claims, and retro adjudications. myUnity has Claims, ClaimCharges, and ClaimChargeAdjustments files with detailed fields. CarePathways has mv_fact_claim, mv_fact_claim_diagnosis, mv_fact_claim_service, mv_fact_pharmacyclaim tables. myEvolv has only face-sheet views (Person Claims on File, Person Claims Balance, Person Invoices on File) — not raw billing tables. TheraOffice has minimal billing (BILLINGSEQUENCE, INVOICETO, PAYER, FEESCHEDULE fields in PTCASE table only, despite having full integrated billing in the product).

insurance_coverage.evidence: myAvatar: 21 insurance/eligibility/authorization tables including eligibility_demographics, eligibility_subscriber, eligibility_dependent, eligibility_dependent_cov, billing_834_coverage, billing_834_payer, service_auth_detail, service_auth_svc, TAR_auth_defaults, history_member_auths_2, history_fund_auth, mso_service_authorization. myUnity: HealthInsurance file (payer type, plan ID, eligibility status, policy number, group info), Eligibility file, Authorization file. CarePathways: dim_client_insurancepolicy, dim_payor, dim_payorplan. myEvolv: minimal — only state-specific insurance event (MA EICS), Benefit Assignment (3 events), Sliding Fee Eligibility form. TheraOffice: INSURANCE1/2/3 and PAYER fields in PTCASE only.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: myAvatar: 34 scheduling tables including AppointmentData, appt_data, appt_data_all, AppointmentSeries, AppointmentRes, AppointmentWaitingRoom, telehealth_appt, telehealth_client, site_specific_check_in, site_specific_check_out, appointment_evv_task, primary_care_visits, staff_appt_not_posted, plus audit tables for all major scheduling actions. myUnity: Appointments file with appointment-level detail. CarePathways: fact_appointment table. myEvolv: essentially absent — the events2do scheduling table is referenced but NOT exported; only 4 tangential scheduling events. TheraOffice: only a BOOKINGRULE reference field, no appointment tables despite having a visual scheduler in the product.

documents_images.evidence: myAvatar: Progress notes (cw_patient_notes + 6 supplement tables), CCD uploads (ccd_upload_audit/config/queue), results uploads (results_upload). Page states 'Some electronic health information might not be available in a table format, such as rich text documents or images. This information is referenced in the extracts.' myEvolv: Base64-encoded attachments inline in JSON (attached_document + mimeType fields), signatures (base64), Received Documents category. myUnity: Attachments file and Documents file as separate export categories. CarePathways: fact_assessmentdocument tables but no general document store. TheraOffice: no document/image tables.

audit_trails.evidence: myAvatar: 46 audit tables covering appointments (audit_appointment_data, audit_deleted_appointment), claims (audit_deleted_claims), movements (audit_deleted_mvmt), treatments (audit_deleted_treatment), consent (audit_consent_for_access), communications (audit_pcp_communications), referrals (audit_referral_consent), billing fees (billing_tx_master_fee_audit), diagnoses (Audit_client_diagnosis_record), coding (coding_chart_audit, coding_diagnoses_audit, coding_services_audit), and more. myEvolv: NOT included — update_log_id field references an update_log table that tracks who entered/modified data, but that table is NOT part of the export. myUnity: no audit files. CarePathways: no audit tables. TheraOffice: has CREATED_USER/CREATED_DATE and MODIFIED_USER/MODIFIED_DATE fields on records (row-level audit) but no dedicated audit log tables.

issues: Secure messaging coverage is inadequate across the platform: myHealthPointe's 3-page documentation covers only Subject Messages with 8 fields exported as PDF/Excel, not structured data; CareConnect Inbox messages appear absent from all product exports.

myEvolv's export omits key operational tables: the events2do scheduling table and the update_log audit table are referenced by foreign keys in exported data but are not themselves included in the export.

TheraOffice's export is severely thin (19 tables, USCDI-focused only) despite the product having full integrated billing, visual scheduling, patient portal, faxing, and practice management capabilities — most of this data appears absent from the export.
myHealthPointe exports messages as PDF or Excel via a report tool rather than structured machine-readable data, which limits utility for data portability.
myAvatar's documentation, while extraordinarily comprehensive, is a single 7,492-page PDF that is very difficult to navigate — no table of contents hyperlinks, no search index.
Documentation dates vary from November 2023 (myHealthPointe) to September 2024 (CarePathways), suggesting inconsistent update cadences across products.

myEvolv's billing data is exposed only as read-only face-sheet views (Person Claims on File, Person Claims Balance) rather than raw billing tables with line-item detail, despite the product generating claims from clinical notes.
CarePathways is a reporting/data warehouse layer, not a primary EHR — its export reflects aggregated/transformed data rather than source records, which may lose detail.
No product appears to export data from Netsmart's RCM services (RevConnect, AlphaCollector) or cross-product CareConnect integrations.

downloaded_files.description: CarePathways Measures Reporting EHI export documentation — 97 pages covering 95 data warehouse tables (dim_* and fact_*) with field-level detail including SQL query examples
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o carepathways-ehi-export-tables-2024.pdf 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/ehi-export-all-tables-2024-carepathways-measures-reporting.pdf'

downloaded_files.description: myAvatar EHI export documentation — ZIP containing a 7,492-page PDF documenting 445 database tables with field-level detail. Covers billing (114 tables), scheduling (34 tables), audit (46 tables), insurance (21 tables), clinical data, and more.
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o myavatar-ehi-export-tables-2023.zip 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/EHI_Export_All_Tables_myAvatar_September_2023.zip'

downloaded_files.description: myEvolv EHI export documentation — ZIP containing 3 files: companion guide (docx) explaining JSON export format, Excel data dictionary crosswalk (115,663 field definitions across 1,679 event types and 250 non-event forms), and SQL queries for schema discovery
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o myevolv-ehi-export-documentation-v2.zip 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/myevolv-all-ehi-export-documentation_v2.zip'

downloaded_files.description: myHealthPointe EHI export documentation — 3 pages describing export of Subject Messages (patient-provider portal messages) via Reports applet with 8 fields. Extremely minimal.
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o myhealthpointe-ehi-export.pdf 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/myhealthpointe-ehi-export.pdf'

downloaded_files.description: myUnity EHI export documentation — 64 pages covering 24 export file types including Demographics, CCD, HealthInsurance, Claims, ClaimCharges, ClaimChargeAdjustments, Appointments, Eligibility, Authorizations, Documents, Attachments, and more. Well-organized with field-level detail.
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o myunity-ehi-export-fall-2024.pdf 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/ehi_export_all_files_myunity_fall_2024.pdf'

downloaded_files.description: TheraOffice EHI export documentation — ZIP containing a 30-page PDF documenting 19 tables (PAT_PROFILE variants + PTCASE). Covers USCDI clinical data but minimal billing, no scheduling, no messages, no documents, no audit.
downloaded_files.curl_command: curl -sL -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36' -o theraoffice-ehi-export-tables-2024.zip 'https://www.ntst.com/-/media/pdfs/certifications/ehi_export_all_tables_theraoffice_2024.zip'

summary: Netsmart Technologies provides separate EHI export documentation for each of its 6 certified products, with quality and coverage varying enormously. myAvatar is exceptional — 445 native database tables covering billing (114 tables), scheduling (34 tables), audit trails (46 tables), and comprehensive clinical data, placing it among the most thorough EHI exports in the industry. myUnity is also strong with 24 well-organized file types covering claims, appointments, insurance, documents, and clinical data. myEvolv is clinically deep (1,679 event types, 115K+ field definitions) but omits key operational tables for scheduling and audit. CarePathways provides solid reporting-layer coverage of 95 tables. TheraOffice is notably thin at 19 tables focused on USCDI clinical data, missing most of the billing, scheduling, and practice management data the product clearly stores. myHealthPointe is the weakest — just 3 pages covering portal message export with 8 fields. The biggest cross-product gap is secure messaging: despite Netsmart offering HIPAA-compliant messaging across its platform, message data is minimally represented in exports.
notes: The table_or_resource_count of 445 in documentation_quality reflects myAvatar specifically, as it is the largest product. Total unique data elements across all products: myAvatar 445 tables, myEvolv 1,679 events + 250 non-events, CarePathways 95 tables, myUnity 24 file types, TheraOffice 19 tables, myHealthPointe 8 fields. GEHRIMED (a 7th product not in our CHPL IDs) also has EHI documentation available. The myHealthPointe page explicitly states it delegates EHI export to the underlying EHR, treating itself as 'relied upon software' — so its message export supplements rather than replaces the EHR exports. myEvolv provides SQL queries that agencies can run to discover their own schema, including custom user-defined forms not in the standard crosswalk — a sophisticated self-service approach.
